metadata.description: Not used, but needed to pass arm-ttk test `Location-Should-Not-Be-Hardcoded`.  We instead use the `workspace-location` which is derived from the LA workspace
[concat('Region to deploy solution resources -- separate from location selection',parameters('location'))]
Workspace name for Log Analytics where Microsoft Sentinel is setup
The ARGOS Cloud Security integration for Microsoft Sentinel allows you to have all your important cloud security events in one place.

properties.description: @{workbookKey=ArgosCloudSecurityWorkbook; logoFileName=argos-logo.svg; description=The ARGOS Cloud Security integration for Microsoft Sentinel allows you to have all your important cloud security events in one place.; dataTypesDependencies=System.Object[]; dataConnectorsDependencies=System.Object[]; previewImagesFileNames=System.Object[]; version=1.0.0; title=ARGOS Cloud Security; templateRelativePath=ARGOSCloudSecurityWorkbook.json; subtitle=; provider=ARGOS Cloud Security}.description
ARGOSCloudSecurity data connector with template version 3.0.0

connectorUiConfig.title: ARGOS Cloud Security
connectorUiConfig.descriptionMarkdown: The ARGOS Cloud Security integration for Microsoft Sentinel allows you to have all your important cloud security events in one place. This enables you to easily create dashboards, alerts, and correlate events across multiple systems. Overall this will improve your organization's security posture and security incident response.

sampleQueries.description: Display all open, exploitable ARGOS Detections on Azure.
sampleQueries.query:
ARGOS_CL
 | where exploitable_b and cloud_s == 'azure' and status_s == 'open'

sampleQueries.description: Display all open, exploitable ARGOS Detections on Azure.
sampleQueries.query:
ARGOS_CL
 | where exploitable_b and cloud_s == 'azure' and status_s == 'open'
 | sort by TimeGenerated

sampleQueries.description: Render a time chart with all open ARGOS Detections on Azure.
sampleQueries.query:
ARGOS_CL
 | where cloud_s == 'azure' and status_s == 'open'
 | summarize count() by TimeGenerated
 | render timechart

sampleQueries.description: Display Top 10, open, exploitable ARGOS Detections on Azure.
sampleQueries.query:
ARGOS_CL
 | where cloud_s == 'azure' and status_s == 'open' and exploitable_b
 | summarize count() by ruleId_s
 | top 10 by count_

dataTypes.name: ARGOS_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
ARGOS_CL
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

value:
ARGOS_CL
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

resourceProvider.permissionsDisplayText: read and write permissions are required.

read permissions to shared keys for the workspace are required. [See the documentation to learn more about workspace keys](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/platform/agent-windows#obtain-workspace-id-and-key).

instructionSteps.description:
Ensure you already own an ARGOS Subscription. If not, browse to [ARGOS Cloud Security](https://argos-security.io) and sign up to ARGOS.

Alternatively, you can also purchase ARGOS via the [Azure Marketplace](https://azuremarketplace.microsoft.com/en-au/marketplace/apps/argoscloudsecurity1605618416175.argoscloudsecurity?tab=Overview).
instructionSteps.title: 1. Subscribe to ARGOS

instructionSteps.description:
Configure ARGOS to forward any new detections to your Sentinel workspace by providing ARGOS with your Workspace ID and Primary Key.

There is **no need to deploy any custom infrastructure**.

Enter the information into the [ARGOS Sentinel](https://app.argos-security.io/account/sentinel) configuration page.

New detections will automatically be forwarded.

[Learn more about the integration](https://www.argos-security.io/resources#integrations)
instructionSteps.title: 2. Configure Sentinel integration from ARGOS

connectorUiConfig.title: ARGOS Cloud Security

            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

properties.description: ExploitableSecurityIssues_AnalyticalRules Analytics Rule with template version 3.0.0
Exploitable Cloud Security Issues are ones that expose cloud resources to the internet and allow initial access to your environment.
properties.displayName: ARGOS Cloud Security - Exploitable Cloud Resources
ARGOS Cloud Security - Exploitable Cloud Resources

properties.descriptionHtml:
Note: Please refer to the following before installing the solution:

• Review the solution Release Notes

• There may be known issues pertaining to this Solution, please refer to them before installing.

The ARGOS Cloud Security integration for Microsoft Sentinel allows you to have all your important cloud security events in one place. This enables you to easily create dashboards, alerts, and correlate events across multiple systems. Overall this will improve your organization's security posture and security incident response.

Microsoft Sentinel Solutions provide a consolidated way to acquire Microsoft Sentinel content like data connectors, workbooks, analytics, and automations in your workspace with a single deployment step.

Data Connectors: 1, Workbooks: 1, Analytic Rules: 1

Learn more about Microsoft Sentinel | Learn more about Solutions
properties.icon: **Important:**_This Microsoft Sentinel Solution is currently in public preview. This feature is provided without a service level agreement, and it's not recommended for production workloads. Certain features might not be supported or might have constrained capabilities. For more information, see [Supplemental Terms of Use for Microsoft Azure Previews](https://azure.microsoft.com/support/legal/preview-supplemental-terms/)._
